definition: to receive guests/to receive patrons (of prostitutes)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: The driver's used to meeting people like that.
Around 200 women from all over the world work here.
sentences.chinese: 來自世界各地的200多名女性在這裏接客。

sentences.english: Soon they were asked to pick.
sentences.chinese: 她們很快就被要求去接客。

sentences.english: The bus picks up the passengers outside the airport.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車在機場外接客。

sentences.english: In addition, she even Kahn was arrested several weeks after pick up.
sentences.chinese: 另外，她甚至在卡恩被捕後數週內多次接客。

sentences.english: There's not a single cab running on the roads of Suizhou now.
sentences.chinese: 現在隨州沒有一輛出租車在路上接客。

definition: to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
to work as a hostess in a bar or KTV
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
